content: Oh hey guys Adam Scott here good to have

using to do texture and I talked a bit about using them and some other of my

so these are the cake molds I'm talking about these are Duff Goldman fondant
cake molds and they have two sets of them they have this like brick texture
with a wood texture inside and then they have another one which has a larger and
smaller cobblestone I'm just showing the brick texture but the packaging is the
same so if you're interested in doing this technique you could pick up these
two sets of molds to make the texture I'm going to use my
cake pattern okay so here it is I'm you can use the Bricklin here so what I do
is I take a spray bottle full of water it's just water and then I spray down
fairly heavily the pattern okay now what I found is that tissues are the exact
size of this mold so I'll are very close so I can cover it with one with one
piece so I'll take it lay it on top of that and then just push it down so the
water kind of goes soaks into the the tissues I'll hit it again a little bit
and then give a little bit of push now be careful because it's easy to pull
this up off of this if you kind of flat hand it and pull up too much so just
give it a gentle pat and get it into those recesses now there's gonna be a
little bit of raised so don't worry about that too much now what I'm going

with the glue you want to make sure you get the edge nice and enough glue on the

into that that tissue okay so now I'll take another piece of tissue out of the

Pat it now you can see the glue is kind of you can see it in there but it'll

enough of glue on it don't worry about that you don't have to totally soak it

thing I did before I'm gonna take my glue
and start just start going over that again and like I say is this is this is
wet the glue will soak into these very nicely okay now I'm going to use one
last sheet this will be the third piece I'm just gonna lay it on there so now I
hit it with some more water and then gently Pat it did it Pat it down now
that's all there is to it so now I just have to let this sit depending on what
kind of conditions is sitting in if you sit it by a heater it'll dry a lot
